page.title: 02Geological Aspects.
page.content: The area is on a bed-rock of sandstone overlaid by a flat clay plain with low hills of sand and gravel,deposited during the Pleistocene period of the Ice Age. There are no obvious geological features of any significance;at first sight the countryside appears flat and featureless,but every dip and hollow was significant to the first settlers to the area.When the River Ouse floods it can be seen that the sites for early settlements were chosen wisely. The Saxon farmers,who came up the river in search of land to cultivate, made their homes near water for ease of transport,but because of the threat of flooding they sited their villages on strategic promontaries of sand and gravel.Such sites are to be found at Newton-on-Ouse and Linton-on-Ouse.
